title: [Large-Scale] Exploring the Effects of Inquiry-Based Language-Integrated Learning in Science Education: Instructional Design Strategies for Pre-Service Teachers

context.prior_knowledge: Core knowledge of science curricula, foundational understanding of educational science principles, and competencies in academic writing and scientific communication
context.additional_context: A course designed for pre-service teachers to understand inquiry-based learning strategies applicable in elementary and secondary science classrooms and to implement confirmatory and structured inquiry methods in real educational settings. Enables self-directed learning using personal devices in an online asynchronous environment, with a strong emphasis on integrated language skills (reading, writing, speaking, listening) required in the scientific inquiry process.

learning_goals: Preservice teachers can explain the differences between confirmatory and structured inquiry using scientific terminology and linguistic expressions, and write a comparative report analyzing the advantages and disadvantages of each.
Based on expectancy-value theory, preservice teachers can assess how inquiry-based learning affects learners’ success expectations and intrinsic values from the perspective of linguistic interaction.

Preservice teachers can design non-face-to-face inquiry-based science lessons in an LMS environment and monitor learners’ linguistic expression skills and participation using formative assessment tools (e.g., discussion boards, reflection journals).
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
